==Distribution==
+
==Past distribution issues==
â
Elive developers ask for a payment (via PayPal) of $10 or more to download the live CD. Alternatively, users can apply for free one-use "invitation codes" in various ways, though difficult and time consuming. The Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 2.0 License does not seem to prohibit exact re-distribution like [http://www.tuxdistro.com/torrents-details.php?id=387 this one].
+
Elive developers asked for a payment (via PayPal) of $10 or more to download the live CD. Alternatively, users could apply for free one-use "invitation codes" in various ways, though difficult and time consuming. The Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 2.0 License does not seemed to prohibit exact re-distribution. Currently (2010), Elive is now freely available.<ref>http://www.elivecd.org/Download/Stable</ref>
â   â
Users may freely download the unstable "Development version" without payment or invitation, but the site labels the development versions "most of the time unstable and not usable for daily use".
  â   â
Tentatively, the next stable release will be openly available for free. This is to be released "tomorrow", a long running joke at elive. It will function freely as a live CD, with a fee charged for installation or a chance to fill out 5 lengthy surveys. (That may re-categorize the software.){{Fact|date=June 2009}}
